learning_objectives: Identify that blood vessels are tubes inside the body
Recognize vessels as important body parts

content.title: What Are Blood Vessels?
content.summary: Blood vessels are special tubes inside your body that carry blood everywhere!

definition.simple: Blood vessels are like tiny roads inside you that your blood travels on.
definition.detailed: Blood vessels are tubes that carry blood from your heart to every part of your body - your fingers, toes, brain, and everywhere! They bring food and oxygen that your body needs.
definition.analogy: Think of blood vessels like roads for cars. But instead of cars, blood travels through them! The blood goes everywhere in your body, just like roads go everywhere in your town.

key_points: Blood vessels are tubes inside your body
Blood vessels go everywhere - to your fingers, toes, and head!
Blood vessels bring food and oxygen to your body parts

visual_description.main_diagram: Simple body outline (like a gingerbread person) with red and blue tubes drawn inside, traveling from the heart to all body parts
visual_description.style: Simple, colorful, cartoon-like, friendly and non-scary

examples.description: When you eat an apple, the good stuff from the apple travels in your blood through blood vessels to make your muscles strong!
examples.visual: Child eating apple → blood vessels carry nutrients → muscles get stronger

examples.description: When you run and play, your blood vessels bring oxygen to your legs so they can keep moving!
examples.visual: Child running → blood vessels in legs highlighted → happy, energetic child

common_misconceptions: Blood vessels are not like water hoses you can see - they're inside your body
Blood doesn't just sit still - it's always moving through vessels
Blood vessels are not scary - they help keep you healthy!
engagement_tips: Have children trace imaginary blood vessels on their arms
Use colorful yarn or string to show how vessels connect places
Let children feel their pulse (blood moving through vessels)

activity_ideas.title: Trace the Path
activity_ideas.description: Use your finger to trace from your heart to your hand, showing where blood vessels go

activity_ideas.title: Blood Vessel Roads
activity_ideas.description: Draw a simple body and add red and blue roads (blood vessels) connecting the heart to different body parts

applies.applicationContext: Part of age-appropriate health education curriculum

used_in.applicationContext: Featured in Peppa Learns About Dr. Valerie educational comic

questions.question: Can you point to where blood vessels are?
questions.correct_answer: Inside your body (child points to body)

questions.question: What do blood vessels do?
questions.correct_answer: They carry blood / They are roads for blood

questions.question: If your toe needs food, how does it get there?
questions.correct_answer: Blood brings it through blood vessels

success_criteria: Child can identify that blood vessels are inside the body
Child understands blood travels through vessels
Child can explain (in simple terms) that vessels carry blood

additional_resources.parent_guide: Explain that blood vessels are not visible like veins you might see on the skin - most are deep inside. Reassure that talking about inside the body is not scary.
additional_resources.teacher_notes: Use lots of visual aids. Let children use their imagination. Connect to things they know (roads, tubes, straws).
fun_facts: If you lined up all your blood vessels, they would go around the Earth more than twice!
Even your little toe has tiny blood vessels bringing it food and oxygen!
Your blood travels through all your blood vessels in less than one minute!

safety_notes.emotional_safety: Keep tone positive and non-scary. Avoid clinical language. Use friendly terms.
safety_notes.content_appropriateness: No frightening images. No discussion of injury or blood loss. Focus on health and how amazing the body is.
